result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court.  Student Intern Jessica Birmingham under the supervision of Kathryn Ginsberg.    Case set for scheduling conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. On the State's motion, Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited.  mn
Court is in trial. Case is rescheduled. Parties notified.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.  bm
Branch 25 will not be in session on 03-30-2022. Clerk contacted the attorneys to reschedule.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
22RM011916  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 03/08/2022
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Remedios Gordiano-Villa in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 25, Judge Rothstein. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Sworn as interpreter: Christina Green
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JV, MRM, JV-M, RV-M

Defendant Remedios Gordiano-Villa in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Remedios Gordiano-Villa in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Remedios Gordiano-Villa appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
